name: psychopathic
content:

psychology
  specialized relating to or suffering from the condition of psychopathy (= a condition in which someone has no feeling for others and does not feel bad about anything they have done): A series of unsolved murders on the island has raised fears that a psychopathic serial killer is on the loose. He was said to have a psychopathic personality. He is part of the 0.5 per cent of the population who can be classified as psychopathic.
morally bad and dangerous or harmful: People are helpless in the face of psychopathic corporations.
informal crazy: He is not very good at snooker but makes up for this with almost psychopathic competitiveness. Related word
psychopath
More examplesFewer examplesThe author has written numerous books on psychopathic criminals.The report recommended that patients with a psychopathic disorder should be separated from others.The real criminals are the destructive, psychopathic, elite investor class. She did not find motherhood entirely wonderful, but thought it would be psychopathic to go back to work before she had to.He's intensely competitive, and when he plays, he kind of goes a bit psychopathic.
